title: I got perma'd after spending $750 after 6+ years of account time
body: I believe I was unfairly perma'd Ive had the account for multiple years and im being charged for past actions and only a few recent. Shit talking in league is what makes it fun and interesting. I started playing the game when I was 11 my brother showed me and and now im 17 being perma'd after spending $750 on the game. I think my chat should just be disabled permanently and my ban uplifted. The ban that set it all off was me saying "irelia ur retarted" and "renekton mad cuz i shat on his boy pussy" which nobody should take offense to that in this day in age. Being treated like its preschool.  Also another point I believe if I cant get my account back then I should get a refund on all i spent. Taking hundreds of dollars and I cant have it back after what I believe is an unfair perma. I am  by  no means a toxic player but when people talk trash I'm not just gonna sit there and take it. People in chat literally can say anything they want to me without punishment but because of past actions I am just banned after 2 insults, crazy. ;(

replies.body: If you would like to truly discuss your ban then please post your entire unedited chat logs here in this thread. That said, spending money =/= immunity to the rules which you seemed to have learned the hard way, and also that other people misbehaving does not excuse your own misbehavior.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Piledriver,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RL60LeAQ,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-11-10T05:00:31.789+0000)
>
> I believe I was unfairly perma'd

No. You weren't.

>Ive had the account for multiple years

Doesn't matter.

>and im being charged for past actions and only a few recent.

Past actions fall off. If you're getting higher levels of punishment up to a permanent ban, it's because it's **too frequent**. If you keep speeding, the police don't just say "well, it's been a year since the first time he sped, so we're just going to ignore that". The only way past behavior gets forgiven is if you stop that behavior.

>Shit talking in league is what makes it fun and interesting.

Insulting and harassing teammates is not "shit talking", it's abuse. Shit talking is things like "lol nice flash", calling someone's computer a toaster, poking fun at people who fuck up (in a **joking** way, not an insulting/rude way), etc.

>now im 17 being perma'd after spending $750 on the game

Neither the amount of money you spend, nor your age, matters.

>I think my chat should just be disabled permanently and my ban uplifted.

Riot tried this. They even tried **unbanning** people. Twice. Over 95% of players given another chance after a permanent ban either remained toxic in chat and were re-banned quickly (meaning they just ruined more games before getting banned again), or they resorted to trolling/griefing (meaning they just ruined more games.... you get the idea). So no, Riot isn't going to make an exception for you because then they'd have to do that for everyone, and that increases toxicity in games.

>Being treated like its preschool.

No, you're simply being asked to not be an asshole to others. That's not just preschool, that's life.

>Also another point I believe if I cant get my account back then I should get a refund on all i spent.

Why? If you buy a ticket to a sporting event and are ejected for violating the rules of that stadium, do they refund your ticket? Nope. If you buy a subscription to, say, a streaming TV channel, with the stipulation it's for personal use, and are kicked off it and banned because you were using it at your business (commercially), do you think you get a refund? Nope.

You agreed to terms as part of your purchase. You broke those terms.

>Taking hundreds of dollars and I cant have it back after what I believe is an unfair perma.

They didn't take it. You gave them it.

>I am  by  no means a toxic player

Your logs and the fact you are acting this way after multiple warnings says differently.

>but when people talk trash I'm not just gonna sit there and take it.

That's your right. Riot has the right to set rules that you can't do that, and if you want to violate them, you can. Riot has the right to enforce their rules and to prohibit you from using their services.

>People in chat literally can say anything they want to me without punishment

They are subject to the same rules you are.

>but because of past actions I am just banned after 2 insults, crazy. ;(

There's a hell of a lot more than 2 insults. Let me point out all parts of your log that are toxic:

> Sir Piledriver: its 30 to 34 im trying my best to carry aatrox stop inting and whining and play the game
> Sir Piledriver: yeah 2 iq league players

Hell, that doesn't even include post game. And this is over half your log. Flaming people for their scores, continually harassing them for mistakes, that's not "trash talk". That's flaming and abuse. Plain and simple.

How do you sincerely compare getting pulled over by the police to being toxic in a videogame, one is literally an illegal action in real life and the other is a minor insult sparked from a petty argument online. You use so many real life examples but its very clear you don't spend much time in it.

Life has rules. If you break those rules, there are consequences.

League has rules. If you break those rules, there are consequences.

One is an "illegal" action in real life, the other is an "illegal" action in League.

You don't have to agree with the rules. You're free to think that going 120 mph on the freeway should be legal. You're free to think that this is "minor" (it's really not, though). That doesn't mean that others are obligated to agree, nor does it mean that the rules are not applicable to you.

Yes there are consequences to life but at the same time consequences in life are moderated and changed based upon legitimate review to what you have done, if you speed in real life and get a ticket but you go to court and have an actual reason for why you didn't deserve to receive a ticket in that circumstance than they can repeal the ticket, he got permanently banned and has actual reasoning to why he shouldn't be banned (whether you agree with it or not) so he should be able to be unbanned.

> [{quoted}](name=Sno3w,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RL60LeAQ,comment-id=0003000100000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T05:45:54.423+0000)

In this case, it's the circumstances that made it a perma-ban.

Your friend is a repeat offender. The perma-ban is not the first step on the punishment ladder, it's after several steps.

The punishment ladder is clearly flawed considering that punishments from years ago are adding up to a perma ban, how is it sensible for smaller bans over years of time to turn into a perma ban over a minor offense?

> [{quoted}](name=Sno3w,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RL60LeAQ,comment-id=000300010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T05:58:58.442+0000)
>
> The punishment ladder is clearly flawed considering that punishments from years ago are adding up to a perma ban, how is it sensible for smaller bans over years of time to turn into a perma ban over a minor offense?

Taking a long break from the game doesn't prove to Riot that someone has improved their behavior. The perma-ban is issued when Riot believes the player unlikely to behave themselves since they've not done so after several punishments.

If Sir Piledriver was actually reformed like they claimed, then this thread would not have existed because that chat log would not have happened.

And just like "he started it" isn't a defense in real life **unless** you're at risk of bodily harm, it's not a defense here.

It can't be "actual reasoning" here but not be actual reasoning in real life, or vice versa.
I am not a cheater and have done nothing wrong but being toxic. Being toxic doesnt justify a perma in any circumstance when I caused no self harm to anyone

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Piledriver,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RL60LeAQ,comment-id=000300010000000000010000,timestamp=2019-11-10T05:58:00.886+0000)
>
> I am not a cheater and have done nothing wrong but being toxic. Being toxic doesnt justify a perma in any circumstance when I caused no self harm to anyone

But Riot disagrees, otherwise perma-ban wouldn't be on the punishment ladder at all for chat behavior. They're the ones who ultimately decides what is bannable or not. If your argument is that no one should be banned for poor chat behavior then that's end of the line as far as your appeal argument goes.

I never said you were a cheater.

You're free to have your opinion about that. That does not mean the rules do not apply to you,  just as how you thinking that "speeding doesn't justify a ticket in any circumstance when I didn't crash" doesn't mean you aren't getting a ticket.

1. Saying somones score is by no means an insult
2. Saying " trist did nothing so you misewell build correctly and TRY to do something" is by no means toxic im just giving him advice
3. Clearly they are not under the same subject of rules if they get no punishment for inting and talking trash

1. So... what's the point of using someone's score in chat then if not to insult them?

2. Saying someone "did nothing" is borderline, but the passive aggressive "TRY to do something" is what makes this clearly an insult.

3. The report system literally cannot have bias. It's like asking a red light camera to have bias - what's it supposed to do, only take a picture when you're driving? Sure, facial recognition is advanced, but **why**? It takes pictures of **everything** and treats them the same.
Likewise, they're subject to the same rules. Just like how you were punished because your toxicity was both **persistent**, **consistent**, and **severe** over multiple games, theirs will be too. You see them in one game - you do not have the data to say whether that was an off game for them and they didn't cross the line or not.

Why should the amount of money spent prevent someone from being held accountable for their behavior? Sure permabans doesn't stop everyone from being toxic in games but that doesn't mean they shouldn't exist at all. By your logic the police force irl should be disbanded simply because criminals will always exist. Just because the punishment system will never completely remove toxic people from the place (no system can) doesn't mean that it's poorly made.
 
> Perma bans should go away for behavior reasons, its silly. 

What's silly is expecting not to have your access to something permanently revoked if multiple warnings and lesser punishments fail to get you to shape up. Like any establishment if someone refuses to behave themselves despite multiple warnings then they should have their access to that place permanently revoked. Not only are they disrupting business with their poor behavior but they're also driving potential customers away. To quote [Kei143](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/mmh6PidR-the-dreaded-downvoteers-in-this-discussion-board?comment=0001000100000000000100000004): 

>When Riot permabans someone, their philosophy is "the chances of this guy reforming isn't a whole lot, we'd rather not have him in the game". Thus in their eyes, they have already written off the toxic player as a paying client.

>From a business standpoint, do they want to remove the toxic guy who has spent $500 but is causing a negative environment for 4-9 other players in every game? Those non-toxics are also spending $500 and probably will spend more, promote the game more when they are enjoying the game AND they won't cause a negative environment.

>I personally think it is a fine argument to protect the ones that are paying money and aren't toxic rather than protecting the ones that may pay the same amount but are toxic.

_______________

> I would just report them to the Better Business Bureau as a consumer. 

You do realize that the BBB is very unreliable right?

> If you do make another account however, just shut your mouth in games, and you'll be fine. If you do talk, just make it friendly chat or tactical things pertaining to in game strategy only.

I agree but you can also chat like a normal civilized person and be fine. Acting like the OP did in their chat logs is not fine.

You do understand that I will never advocate for someone losing their money and time put into a game for a behavioral reason, right? We will never agree on this. 

I have this stance because with regard to real life, police and laws, you pay a fine or do jail time. So I reasonably would expect a less permanent punishment for something in a game where you can make purchases on average $5-$100 a pop and lose it all in one shot for a racist comment. 

No need to explain the way the system works, I am fully aware, having been subject to it's dumb suspensions and almost losing thousands of dollars in RP purchases because Riot can't figure out how to take the chat client out of their game, and instead punishes paying customers for playing in their Toxic Arena and expects adults and grown ups to figure out their problems for them, or pay with a perma ban. 

Riot is unreliable with their ToU and rules, nothing is concrete and paying customers should be given more protection over what they put their hard earned dollar into. 
Hench why I say, perma bans should not exist in this game, only chat bans, or Riot should disable chat completely so we don't have to worry about the troll wars in games, and put our money on the line.
